result.execSummary:
The defendant Regina Marie Heather was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing Hearing on Revocation-July 19, 2018

18CF47 and 16CF24 called together. Defendant Regina Marie Heather in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Yang. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Wang has no objections to revocation order. Parties have a joint recommendation, State will move to dismiss 18CF47 and in 16CF24 Count 1-2yrs initial confinement/2yrs ES, concurrent to sentence in Grant Cty. Count 2-3yr probation consecutive to any other sentences. 203 days credit. Court voids DPA on Count 2. 

Court orders:

16CF24:
Count 1-4 years in Wisconsin State Prison (Taycheedah designated as reception center): 2yrs initial confinement/2yrs ES, concurrent to the sentence in 17CF89 Grant Cty case. 203 days credit. Eligible for drug treatment program but not youthful offender. All court costs converted to a civil judgment.
Count 2-3yr probation consecutive to any other sentences.

Conditions of probation: Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming recommended by agent, must submit DNA sample, obey rules and regulations of probation. Costs waived. 

18CF47-Dismissed and read in. 

Firearms and voting rights suspension given.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 19, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on July 19, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Regina Marie Heather in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Yang for motion hearing on State's motion to revoke DPA in 16CF24, sentencing after revocation in 16CF24, and arraignment in 18CF47. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Counsel ask for reset; note that Def is facing sentencing after revocation in Grant County; asks that these matters be continued until after that time. Court adjourns these matters to 7/19 at 1:30.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for July 19, 2018 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 19, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Transcript - Plea & Sentencing Hearing - 10/25/16

Atty. Yang questions the format of entry for the felony diversion agreement. Clerk's review of the deferred pros written agreement finds that, per the written DPA order, the Defendant entered a no contest plea and the Court withheld entry of the disposition/finding. Clerk's minutes indicate that the Defendant entered a no contest plea and the Court entered a finding of guilty, then ordering DPA in lieu of sentence. Clerk suggests Atty. Yang order a transcript of the 10-25-16 hearing.

Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.

In 18CF47, Def waives her right to prelim. Court's colloquy with Def re prelim waiver. Court orders bindover.

In 16CF24, Atty. Yang asks for continuance to at least mid-June; wants chance to speak with DA; notes Def is also going through probation revocation process.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 6, 2018 at 10:00 am.

16CF24 and 16CF106. Defendant Regina Marie Heather in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA informs the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution calling for pleas to counts 1 and 2 in 16CF24 and DRI of count 3; State to dismiss 16CF106 in its entirety.  On count 1 in 16CF24, jt recommendation is for 3 years probation; count 2 recommendation is for 3-year DPA.  State will not charge out newer referral matter from RCPD.

Def pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence withheld for 3 years probation on count 1 - Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling or education ordered by the agent.  Pay single set of costs.
Count 2 - diversion agreement for 3 years.

16RI94 referral dismissed/read-in as well as count 3 in 16CF24 and 16CF106.

0 days credit via stipulation.

Defendant not to possess or consume any controlled substanced for which she does not hold a valid prescription.  Submit to testing of blood, breath or urine by law enforcement to monitor compliance.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by phone means for Defendant Regina Marie Heather. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Regina Marie Heather in court, in custody.  Initial appearance/bail hearing.  Atty. M states that she may have a conflict as defense counsel; representing for this hearing only.  DA notes def is on p/p hold; asks for $5000 signature bond with conditions to include no possession/consumption of controlled substances with testing of blood, breath or urine by law enforcement to monitor compliance.  DA states that additional charges are possible.  Court sets 5k signature bond with the conditions requested.

Court adjourns this matter to allow SPD time to appoint counsel; will complete the initial appearance at the next date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
